description: Single storey side to rear extension, Alterations to roof to raise ridge height, form end gables and rear dormer, with juliette balconies, Three roof lights in front roof slope, windows in gable ends (Demolition of side to rear extension)
decision_conditions:
<p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: 0cm; line-height: normal;">The
proposal to raise the ridge height together with the proposed rear dormer, by reason of its poor design and failure to achieve visual containment would result in an unsympathetic and overly bulky addition to the property and thereby fail to complement the existing character of the original bungalow and
would appear as an incongruous feature in the streetscene and be harmful to the
character and appearance of the area, contrary to the high quality design
aspirations of the National Planning Policy Framework (2023), Policy D3 of the
London Plan (2021), Core Policy CS1 (B) of the Harrow Core Strategy (2012),
policy DM 1 of the Harrow Development Management Policies Local Plan (2013), policy GR1 of the Emerging Harrow Local Plan (Regulation 19) (November 2024) and
the adopted Supplementary Planning Document: Residential Design Guide (2010).<span style="font-size:12.0pt;font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif;mso-fareast-font-family:
&quot;Times New Roman&quot;;mso-bidi-font-family:&quot;Times New Roman&quot;"><o:p></o:p></span></p>
